com.bit6.sdk.websocket

Class WebSocketWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.bit6.sdk.websocket.WebSocketWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class WebSocketWriter
extends java.lang.Thread
    WebSocket writer, the sending leg of a WebSockets connection. This is run on it's background thread with it's own message loop. The only method that needs to be called (from foreground thread) is forward(), which is used to forward a WebSockets message to this object (running on background thread) so that it can be formatted and sent out on the underlying TCP socket.

      • WebSocketWriter

        public WebSocketWriter(android.os.Handler master,
               java.net.Socket socket,
               WebSocketOptions options,
               java.lang.String threadName)
        Create new WebSockets background writer.
        Parameters:
        looper - The message looper of the background thread on which this object is running.
        master - The message handler of master (foreground thread).
        socket - The socket channel created on foreground thread.
        options - WebSockets connection options.

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public void forward(java.lang.Object message)
        Call this from the foreground (UI) thread to make the writer (running on background thread) send a WebSocket message on the underlying TCP.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to send to WebSockets writer. An instance of the message classes inside WebSocketMessage or another type which then needs to be handled within processAppMessage() (in a class derived from this class).
